TopicTitle: should i make a new save

Articles.Content:
Should i make a new save now that 1.0 is out?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-06T18:51:21Z" title="08/06/2015 06:51  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 6, 2015</time> by carneyvich**
I guess if you feel you have to. But your saves havent been broken yet then I guess you're still good though too. But I always find things seem cleaner and faster with a nice shiny new save....

It's up to you. Not required, but you can depending on your gaming goals. There might be a few oddities, like if you have active flights without enough chutes or something on it's way to Eve for an aerobrake. Those might require some additional work to "rescue" from potential demise. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Cheers,

~Claw

If your save is from beta KSP, you don't need to create a new save; but due to the changes in aerodynamics and engines thrust asl, it is likely that a significant part of your rockets will not be able to fly well anymore, so keep that in mind. You may even want to redesign your rockets from scratch.
